snippet: In life, firefighters from disparate states and backgrounds work side by side. But in death, families say, they are sifted into categories based on their official employment status.
abstract: Questions about how to compensate the families of dead firefighters have a greater resonance in 2013, one of the deadliest years for wildfire crews in decades; firefighter families say financial lifelines provided by the government are distributed inequitably, and are largely dependent on whether the firefighters were full time or part time and whether they were employed by local, state or federal governments or private contractors.
lead_paragraph: In life, firefighters from disparate states and backgrounds work side by side. But in death, families say, they are sifted into categories based on their official employment status.

headline.main: Firefighters’ Survivor Benefits Value Some Lives Over Others
headline.print_headline: Firefighters’ Survivor Benefits Value Some Lives Over Others
